object.name: sendPoll
object.description: Use this method to send a native poll. On success, the sent Message is returned.
object.html_description: Use this method to send a native poll. On success, the sent Message is returned.
object.rst_description: Use this method to send a native poll. On success, the sent :class:`aiogram.types.message.Message` is returned.

annotations.description: Unique identifier of the business connection on behalf of which the message will be sent
annotations.html_description: Unique identifier of the business connection on behalf of which the message will be sent
annotations.rst_description: Unique identifier of the business connection on behalf of which the message will be sent
annotations.name: business_connection_id

annotations.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername). Polls can't be sent to channel direct messages chats.
annotations.html_description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername). Polls can't be sent to channel direct messages chats.
annotations.rst_description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format :code:`@channelusername`). Polls can't be sent to channel direct messages chats.
annotations.name: chat_id

annotations.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of the forum; for forum supergroups only
annotations.html_description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of the forum; for forum supergroups only
annotations.rst_description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of the forum; for forum supergroups only
annotations.name: message_thread_id

annotations.description: Poll question, 1-300 characters
annotations.html_description: Poll question, 1-300 characters
annotations.rst_description: Poll question, 1-300 characters
annotations.name: question

annotations.description: Mode for parsing entities in the question. See formatting options for more details. Currently, only custom emoji entities are allowed
annotations.html_description: Mode for parsing entities in the question. See formatting options for more details. Currently, only custom emoji entities are allowed
annotations.rst_description: Mode for parsing entities in the question. See `formatting options <https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options>`_ for more details. Currently, only custom emoji entities are allowed
annotations.name: question_parse_mode

annotations.description: A JSON-serialized list of special entities that appear in the poll question. It can be specified instead of question_parse_mode
annotations.html_description: A JSON-serialized list of special entities that appear in the poll question. It can be specified instead of question_parse_mode
annotations.rst_description: A JSON-serialized list of special entities that appear in the poll question. It can be specified instead of *question_parse_mode*
annotations.name: question_entities

annotations.description: A JSON-serialized list of 2-12 answer options
annotations.html_description: A JSON-serialized list of 2-12 answer options
annotations.rst_description: A JSON-serialized list of 2-12 answer options
annotations.name: options

annotations.description: True, if the poll needs to be anonymous, defaults to True
annotations.html_description: True, if the poll needs to be anonymous, defaults to True
annotations.rst_description: :code:`True`, if the poll needs to be anonymous, defaults to :code:`True`
annotations.name: is_anonymous

annotations.description: Poll type, 'quiz' or 'regular', defaults to 'regular'
annotations.html_description: Poll type, “quiz” or “regular”, defaults to “regular”
annotations.rst_description: Poll type, 'quiz' or 'regular', defaults to 'regular'
annotations.name: type

annotations.description: True, if the poll allows multiple answers, ignored for polls in quiz mode, defaults to False
annotations.html_description: True, if the poll allows multiple answers, ignored for polls in quiz mode, defaults to False
annotations.rst_description: :code:`True`, if the poll allows multiple answers, ignored for polls in quiz mode, defaults to :code:`False`
annotations.name: allows_multiple_answers

annotations.description: 0-based identifier of the correct answer option, required for polls in quiz mode
annotations.html_description: 0-based identifier of the correct answer option, required for polls in quiz mode
annotations.rst_description: 0-based identifier of the correct answer option, required for polls in quiz mode
annotations.name: correct_option_id

annotations.description: Text that is shown when a user chooses an incorrect answer or taps on the lamp icon in a quiz-style poll, 0-200 characters with at most 2 line feeds after entities parsing
annotations.html_description: Text that is shown when a user chooses an incorrect answer or taps on the lamp icon in a quiz-style poll, 0-200 characters with at most 2 line feeds after entities parsing
annotations.rst_description: Text that is shown when a user chooses an incorrect answer or taps on the lamp icon in a quiz-style poll, 0-200 characters with at most 2 line feeds after entities parsing
annotations.name: explanation

annotations.description: Mode for parsing entities in the explanation. See formatting options for more details.
annotations.html_description: Mode for parsing entities in the explanation. See formatting options for more details.
annotations.rst_description: Mode for parsing entities in the explanation. See `formatting options <https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options>`_ for more details.
annotations.name: explanation_parse_mode

annotations.description: A JSON-serialized list of special entities that appear in the poll explanation. It can be specified instead of explanation_parse_mode
annotations.html_description: A JSON-serialized list of special entities that appear in the poll explanation. It can be specified instead of explanation_parse_mode
annotations.rst_description: A JSON-serialized list of special entities that appear in the poll explanation. It can be specified instead of *explanation_parse_mode*
annotations.name: explanation_entities

annotations.description: Amount of time in seconds the poll will be active after creation, 5-600. Can't be used together with close_date.
annotations.html_description: Amount of time in seconds the poll will be active after creation, 5-600. Can't be used together with close_date.
annotations.rst_description: Amount of time in seconds the poll will be active after creation, 5-600. Can't be used together with *close_date*.
annotations.name: open_period

annotations.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the poll will be automatically closed. Must be at least 5 and no more than 600 seconds in the future. Can't be used together with open_period.
annotations.html_description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the poll will be automatically closed. Must be at least 5 and no more than 600 seconds in the future. Can't be used together with open_period.
annotations.rst_description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the poll will be automatically closed. Must be at least 5 and no more than 600 seconds in the future. Can't be used together with *open_period*.
annotations.name: close_date

annotations.description: Pass True if the poll needs to be immediately closed. This can be useful for poll preview.
annotations.html_description: Pass True if the poll needs to be immediately closed. This can be useful for poll preview.
annotations.rst_description: Pass :code:`True` if the poll needs to be immediately closed. This can be useful for poll preview.
annotations.name: is_closed

annotations.description: Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.
annotations.html_description: Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.
annotations.rst_description: Sends the message `silently <https://telegram.org/blog/channels-2-0#silent-messages>`_. Users will receive a notification with no sound.
annotations.name: disable_notification

annotations.description: Protects the contents of the sent message from forwarding and saving
annotations.html_description: Protects the contents of the sent message from forwarding and saving
annotations.rst_description: Protects the contents of the sent message from forwarding and saving
annotations.name: protect_content

annotations.description: Pass True to allow up to 1000 messages per second, ignoring broadcasting limits for a fee of 0.1 Telegram Stars per message. The relevant Stars will be withdrawn from the bot's balance
annotations.html_description: Pass True to allow up to 1000 messages per second, ignoring broadcasting limits for a fee of 0.1 Telegram Stars per message. The relevant Stars will be withdrawn from the bot's balance
annotations.rst_description: Pass :code:`True` to allow up to 1000 messages per second, ignoring `broadcasting limits <https://core.telegram.org/bots/faq#how-can-i-message-all-of-my-bot-39s-subscribers-at-once>`_ for a fee of 0.1 Telegram Stars per message. The relevant Stars will be withdrawn from the bot's balance
annotations.name: allow_paid_broadcast

annotations.description: Unique identifier of the message effect to be added to the message; for private chats only
annotations.html_description: Unique identifier of the message effect to be added to the message; for private chats only
annotations.rst_description: Unique identifier of the message effect to be added to the message; for private chats only
annotations.name: message_effect_id

annotations.description: Description of the message to reply to
annotations.html_description: Description of the message to reply to
annotations.rst_description: Description of the message to reply to
annotations.name: reply_parameters

annotations.type: InlineKeyboardMarkup or ReplyKeyboardMarkup or ReplyKeyboardRemove or ForceReply
annotations.description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard, custom reply keyboard, instructions to remove a reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user
annotations.html_description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard, custom reply keyboard, instructions to remove a reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user
annotations.rst_description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an `inline keyboard <https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards>`_, `custom reply keyboard <https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#keyboards>`_, instructions to remove a reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user
annotations.name: reply_markup

annotations.description: Pass True if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found
annotations.html_description: Pass True if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found
annotations.rst_description: Pass :code:`True` if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found
annotations.name: allow_sending_without_reply

annotations.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message
annotations.html_description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message
annotations.rst_description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message
annotations.name: reply_to_message_id
